bibl.title: Letter from Walter Reed to the Surgeon General, June 30, 1876

div1.p: Reed reports that he has taken up his temporary assignment at his posting at Fort Yuma, California.

div1.head: Letter from Walter Reed to the Surgeon General, June 30, 1876
div1.opener:
Fort Yuma, Cal.,
June 30th 1876.
Reed, Walter,
Ass't. Surgeon, U.S.A.
Personal Report of
Station and duties, for
the month of June, 1876.
385
Fort Yuma. California,
June 30th 1876.
To
The Surgeon General, U.S.A.
Washington, D.C.
Sir:
div1.p:
I have the honor to forward the following Per-
sonal Report of station & duties for the
month of June, 1876.

In compliance with S.O. No. 71, Headquarters of the
Army, Adjutant General's Office, Washington, D.C.
April 8th 1896, I left San Francisco, en route to
the Dept. of Arizona, on June 1st, proceeded, via
“Colorado Steam Navigation Co.”, to Yuma, California
arriving on the 31st day of June.

Since that date, I have been assigned to
temporary duty, at this post, in compliance with
Special Orders No. 73, Headquarters Department
of Arizona, Prescott, June 9th 1876 (copy enclosed.)-
div1.closer:
Very respectfully,
Your ob't. Servant, Walter Reed, Ass't. Surgeon, U.S.A.
